title: ISic000095. Statue base for Gnaeus Pollienus
body:
Facsimile Images

1CNPOLLIENOCNF
2TRMIL
3LEGIOXII

Apparatus criticus

  • Text from autopsy

English translation

To Gnaeus Pollienus, son of Gnaeus, military tribune of the 12th legion

commentary

This individual is also honoured in ISic000096, found in Termini in 1876. It is suggested also (e.g. Wilson 1990: 42 n.87) that this man is the son of the Pollienus honoured at Haluntium, possibly in the civil war period (ISic001190). A further inscription (ISic000098) records another (anonymous) individual from the same Legio XII Fulminata. The multiple references to this legion encourage the hypothesis that it was veterans of this legion which were settled in the colonial foundation of Augustus in 21 BC (so, e.g., Manganaro 1988: 42). The distinctive breccia from the area of San Marco d'Alunzio suggests a deliberate choice of prestigious material.

bibliography

  • 10.7349 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000589
  • 13 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002137
  • 5093 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000352
  • Fiorelli NSA 1879 287 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001392
  • Wilson 1990 38-39 n.57 fig.31 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001509
  • Wilson 1988 97 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001430
  • Manganaro 1988 42 tav.XI.18 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001427
